com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.application

Class ApplicationLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.application.ApplicationLoader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultApplicationLoaderListener

    public class ApplicationLoader
extends Object
    A ApplicationLoader is responsible for loading a web application's Stormpath Application resource at application startup and making it available in the ServletContext. Other ServletContext aware components loaded after this one can access the Application instance by using the Application interface name as the servlet context attribute key: 
     Application app = (Application)servletContext.getAttribute(Application.class.getName());

    ApplicationResolver

    The ApplicationLoader will delegate application instance lookup to an ApplicationResolver implementation. By default, the DefaultApplicationResolver implementation will be used. See that implementation's JavaDoc to learn about how it discovers the application instance.

    Custom ApplicationResolver Implementation

    If you need to create a custom ApplicationResolver implementation, you can implement the ApplicationResolver interface yourself and specify that implementation class name as follows:

     <context-param>
     <param-name>stormpathApplicationResolverClass</param-name>
     <param-value>com.mycompany.myapp.stormpath.MyCustomApplicationResolver</param-value>
 </context-param>

    And that class will be instantiated and used to lookup the Application instance.

    If you do not specify this context-param, DefaultApplicationResolver is assumed by default.

    Since:
    1.0.RC3
    See Also:
    ApplicationResolver, DefaultApplicationResolver

    • Method Detail

      • getApplication

        public Application getApplication(javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext)
                           throws IllegalStateException
        Looks up and returns the web application's registered Stormpath Application instance and assigns that instance to the ServletContext for that context's lifespan.

        The app is obtained by instantiating a ApplicationResolver implementation class, and the class name can be specified as a stormpathApplicationResolverClass context parameter. If this parameter is not specified, the default DefaultApplicationResolver implementation is assumed.

        Parameters:
        servletContext - current servlet context
        Returns:
        the new Stormpath Application instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if an existing Application instance has already been initialized and associated with the specified ServletContext.

      • determineApplicationResolverClass

        protected Class<?> determineApplicationResolverClass(javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext)
        Return the ApplicationResolver implementation class to use, either the default DefaultApplicationResolver or a custom class if specified.
        Parameters:
        servletContext - current servlet context
        Returns:
        the ApplicationResolver implementation class to use
        See Also:
        APP_RESOLVER_CLASS_PARAM_NAME, DefaultApplicationResolver

      • doGetApplication

        protected Application doGetApplication(javax.servlet.ServletContext sc)
        Looks up an Application based on the specified ServletContext.

        This implementation determines a Application implementation class to use. That class is instantiated, returned, and invoked.

        This allows a custom ApplicationResolver implementation to be specified via a ServletContext init-param if desired. If not specified, the default DefaultApplicationResolver implementation will be used.

        Parameters:
        sc - current servlet context
        Returns:
        the constructed Stormpath config instance

      • removeApplication

        public void removeApplication(javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext)
        Unbinds the Application instance for the given servlet context.
        Parameters:
        servletContext - the web apps servlet context
